bboxes.raw_text:
ATLANTA The new civil
rights act was found to be con-
stitutional by three federal judges
Wednesday in the first two court
tests. The court issued injunc-
lions against the Pickrick
Restaurant and the Heart of At
lanta Motel Corp.


Injunctions we're delayed until
Aug. ii allowing for appeals
to the Supreme Court.
Motel owner Moreton Role
ston, an attorney, said he would
comply but he would appeal i'm
mediately.


Lester Maddox. restaurant
owner, who had chased Negroes
from his place with a gun on
July 8, said he'd wait until
August IL.

Mrs. Hattie Hardison, of In
dianapolis, Indiana, is the house
guest of Mr.. and Mrs. Edward
Banks, 2137 E. Broadway Rd.
Mrs. Hardison is Mrs. Banks
mother.


They we're surprised by a visit
from Mr.. and Mrs. Walter Bean
and their son, Kenneth, also from
Indianapolis.


The Walter Beans are spending
a week in Flagstaff with his
brother and sister in law, Mr..
and Mrs. Jim Bean, who drove
them to Phoenix.

SAN FRANCISCO A Negro
became the first of his race ever
to be made an assistant vice
president of Bank Of America,
worlds largest privately owned
bank.


E. Fred Morrow, who was an
administrative assistant to Presi-
dent Dwight D. Eisenhower and
author of the book, "Black Man
in the White House. was named
last week.


The bank recently has been
a target of picketing by groups
charging that it discriminates
against hiring Negroes for other
than minor jobs.


The bank denied the charges.
Recently after a breakoff of nego-
tiadons, an attorney for the bank
charged that, Bill Bradley, San
Francisco leader for the Con-
gress of Racial Equality, acted
in bad faith just to draw at
tention.


Morrow has been vice presi-
dent of the African-American
Institute, an institution for de-
velopment Of cooperative re-
lationships between the peoples
of Africa and the United States.


Morrow attended Bowdoin, got
his law degree from Rutgers.
Prior to World War II, he was
a field secretary for the Ma
tional Association for the Adj
vancement of Colored People.
He became a major in World
War II.


Before he entered government
service, he was writer in the
press information division of the
Columbia Broadcasting System.

Bank Names A
Negro Vice


President

Martha Chapter fl held sum-
mer party We'd. July is at 1909
S. 9th Ave. Luncheon was served.
Mrs. Lille Mae Hall. worthy
Mrs. Lille Mae Hall, worthy
matron and Ocie Slaughter,
worthy patron, presided.


Rev. ]. Williams, 1884 w.
Apache is vacationing in Arkan-
sas, Louisiana and Mississippi.


Mrs. Leola Redmond, l412 S.
9th Ave. is visiting her son in
Arkansas.


Mrs. Ora Jackson entertained
the Famous IL Club at her home,
1924 w. Grant last Friday.


Mrs. Gertrude Albert, 1884
S. 9th Ave., and her brother,
Rev. ]. W. Reese, Of Detroit,
were reunited after SO years.


Mrs. Aurelia Rogers, 1928 So.
9th Ave., is vacationing in Red
lands, Oakland and Los Angeles,
Calf.


Mr.. and Mira. A. Ward of San
Diego, Calf, are visiting Mrs.
Wards mother, Mrs. Winnie
Murphy, 1884 w. Sherman.

Dr. Ann ]. Julian, famed scientist Dr. Percy L. Julian
Park reelected national vice president OF the
Links Inc America national assembly which
was held In Nassau, Bahamas Islands


Miami, Fla chapter the host group large dele
CATION from regional attended the sessions.


Julian address Womanpower Sheis directing
a research project on the same subject


pledged aid the legal defense and education
NAACP The organization will adopt national art pro-
iec and emphasize national and international affairs.


members of the western delegation incud
ing Mesdames Jimmie Brashear Nannette
Vivian Nance vice-charman; Myrtle Flint
Varea Guey Oheia Johnson Josephine Smith, Natl recording

Esther Nelson retiring charman Catherine Lampn Alice Wor

Solomon Mildred Reynolds Dr. Blanche Lazzo jose
Stokes and Blanche Standfer.
